Class MazeFrame

java.lang.Object
  MazeFrame

public class MazeFrame
extends java.lang.Object

GUI class for the maze game. Responsible for displaying the current game state of the maze in addition to a side panel containing relevant game variables and navigation options. String identifier constants are used to determine which sprite image to display.

Author:
Mohammad Ghasembeigi, Gavin Tam
See Also:
Maze, Game

Constructor Detail

MazeFrame

public MazeFrame(Game game,
                 int width,
                 int height)
Constructor for the maze frame.

Parameters:
game - - Game object with game state information.
width - - Width of maze grid to be painted (number of tiles).
height - - Height of maze grid to be painted (number of tiles).
Method Detail

update

public void update(Maze m)
Update only GUI components that will have changed since initialisation or a previous update cal1l. These components include blocks with the player, enemy and unlocked door.

Parameters:
m - Maze that GUI will use to create a visual representation of the maze game.

init

public void init(Maze m)
Initialise GUI components in frame based on the initial state of maze.

Parameters:
m - Maze that GUI will use to create a visual representation of the maze game.

getFrame

public javax.swing.JFrame getFrame()
Gets the frame component of the maze frame. This is where all the components are added onto.

Returns:
the frame component of the maze frame
